0.sentence: there is much which has been said in other reviews about the features of this phone , it is a great phone , mine worked without any problems right out of the box .

1.sentence: after several years of torture in the hands of at&t customer service i am delighted to drop them , and look forward to august 2004 when i will convert our other 3 family-phones from at&t to t-mobile !

2.sentence: i have had the phone for 1 week , the signal quality has been great in the detroit area ( suburbs ) and in my recent road trip between detroit and northern kentucky ( cincinnati ) i experienced perfect signal and reception along i-75 , far superior to at & t 's which does not work along several long stretches on that same route .

3.sentence: my favorite features , although there are many , are the speaker phone , the radio and the infrared .

4.sentence: the speaker phone is very functional and i use it in the car , very audible even with freeway noise .

5.sentence: the infrared is a blessing if you have a previous nokia and want to transfer your old phone book to this phone , saved me hours of re-entering my numbers .

6.sentence: the day finally arrived when i was sure i 'd leave sprint .

7.sentence: after years with that carrier 's expensive plans and horrible customer service , portability seemed heaven-sent .

8.sentence: here 's the brief synopsis : the phone is tiny , cute , feels kind of " plastic-like " ( as if it might break ) , but seems pretty sturdy .

9.sentence: it has lots of little cute features , my favorite being the games and the pim ( personal information manager -- i.e. organizer ) , and the radio !

10.sentence: i spent hours setting up the stations ( accepts about 13-14 , i believe ) , though the reception is unpredictable .

11.sentence: the headset that comes with the phone has good sound volume but it hurts the ears like you cannot imagine !

12.sentence: the phone comes with okay ringtones , some decent backgrounds / screensavers , but the phone has very little memory ( mine had 230kb as it arrived from amazon , so you do n't have too many options on what you can put on there ) .

13.sentence: the colors on the screen are not as crisp as i 'd have liked them to be .

14.sentence: the backlight on the phone goes off way too quickly ( dangerous when you 're driving at night ) , and there 's no way to change this --

15.sentence: the buttons on the phone are small , even for my small fingertips , but you get used to them rather quickly .

16.sentence: the menu options are uncreative , as you can 't see a full screen of menu items to pick from ; you have to scroll up and down to find what you 're looking for ( yes , this is minor , but not when you 're trying to keep your eye on the road ! ) .

18.sentence: i have excellent hearing but the volume level on this phone is especially quiet .

19.sentence: on the up-side , the phone has amazing battery life .

20.sentence: i do like this phone overall ( would give it a 3.5 ) , but unforutnately , i am returning it .

21.sentence: i assumed they had exceptional service , but their reception in my area ( los angeles ) is horrendous .

22.sentence: also , their t-zones , although cheap ( $ 4.99 / mo. ) never works .

23.sentence: since i received the phone , i spent countless hours on the phone with customer service reps who promised t-zones would work " in 24 hours " .

24.sentence: i must have heard this about a dozen times over the span of 2 weeks , when t-zones never worked .

25.sentence: apparently , t-mobile is heavily back-logged and can 't keep up with demands .

26.sentence: in all fairness , customer reps are very nice , and they ( most of them ) try hard to answer your questions .

27.sentence: t-mobile is trying very hard , and again -- they do have pretty good csr 's .

28.sentence: however , the calls constantly drop in my area and i experince mega-static , to the point where i 'd have to dial numbers 6-7 times to get a clear line .

29.sentence: i 'm staying with sprint , and though i fear that their csr is n't nearly as good as t-mobile 's , the clarity of their reception is exceptional .

30.sentence: while i like the performance of the phone in every regard , i would buy another one solely upon the apparent indestructibility of it .

32.sentence: no other color phone has the combination of features that the 6610 offers .

33.sentence: from the speakerphone that can be used up to 15 feet away with clarity , to the downloadable poly-graphic megatones that adds a personal touch to this nifty phone .

34.sentence: whether you 're taking a brisk jog , waiting for a bus or just having lunch at the park , you 'll be glad you had the fm radio .

35.sentence: i treat the battery well and it has lasted .

37.sentence: some of the higher pitched rings are very easy to hear , but not easy to listen to .

38.sentence: the more subtle tones that were included with the phone are hard to hear at times .

40.sentence: overall this has been my favorite phone that i have owned .

41.sentence: great battery life , perfect size , but a tid bit quieter than i would like .

49.sentence: this is a very nice phone , but there is no warranty on it .

50.sentence: we got two phones for the t-mobile family plan ( indeed very easy to switch to the family plan ) and one came with a broken headphone ( can hear but cannot be heard ) and one died today after less than two weeks of use .

51.sentence: when i got it home , i discovered that the menu options for sending messages via either text or email simply were n't there :

52.sentence: while i had the phone , the positive features were : good sound quality and an excellent fm phone and earpiece .

53.sentence: negative : impossibly tiny and difficult to operate , barely visible , power button .

56.sentence: only con i can think of is no camera ... .

58.sentence: anything this phone does , it does perfectly .

59.sentence: the speakerphone , the radio , all features work perfectly .

60.sentence: this phone has a very cool and useful feature -- the speakerphone .

61.sentence: as said before this works perfectly .

62.sentence: you can adjust the volume to be heard anywhere or so that it does n't make that big of a disturbance .

63.sentence: the person on the other end of the call can hear you perfectly .

64.sentence: you can be up to about 3 feet away from it and it will still work perfectly .

65.sentence: only one complaint about the speakerphone , you can only activate the speakerphone feature once the person you are calling answers the phone , not while it is ringing .

66.sentence: this phone is one of the few phones that have an fm radio tuner built in .

67.sentence: this radio receives fairly decent reception but not nearly as good as a normal radio , but as long as the stations are coming in clearly the phone 's radio should work perfectly .

68.sentence: i bought this phone for my trip to south africa and it worked almost perfectly .

69.sentence: the only problem i had was a small glitch with t-mobile .

70.sentence: anywhere i went in south africa this phone received full bar reception .

71.sentence: another benefit of this phone is that it is truly an international phone ; the 6610 is sold in almost everywhere in the world .

72.sentence: this means that there is a good chance that this phone will not break easily like typical american phones .

73.sentence: when you put this phone in your pocket you forget it is there ; it is unbelievably small and oh , so light .

74.sentence: this is a benefit for many reasons ; one being just for appearance , your pants wo n't be bulging with this phone in your pocket .

75.sentence: the battery life on this phone is surreal .

76.sentence: i 've used the speakerphone for almost two hours once and the battery did not even go down one single bar .

77.sentence: it is amazing that the battery lasts so long when the phone is so small and light .

78.sentence: this phone has many other features , ir , ; just to name one , the features above i view as the most beneficial .

79.sentence: the phone has a few minor inconveniences , but only because it lacks those features , bluetooth and high spend internet , but there are very few problems with things that you expected this phone to do .

80.sentence: overall , i highly recommend this phone .

81.sentence: it is a perfect phone in such a small and appealing package .

82.sentence: size - extremely small and convenient will fit in your pocket and not bother you .

83.sentence: sound - excellent polyphonic ringing tones are very nice ( check cons ) it also doubles as a radio , which is a nice feature when you are bored .

84.sentence: speakerphone - loud and clear has some nice extra features like currency converter and a stopwatch .

85.sentence: surfing the web on it is nice as well , i just wish there were more wap pages available .

86.sentence: ring tones only come with crazy songs and annoying rings , there is only one ring that sounds close to a regular ring .

87.sentence: the screen is easily scratched but if you have the warranty you should be able to swap it out .

90.sentence: buttons do seem a little sticky tho .. and the hands free kits ' connector might be a problem ..

91.sentence: although the nokia 6610 is a little short on the features department , it is an outstanding piece of hardware for doing what it was primarily meant to do : to be a wireless telephone .

92.sentence: the reception and sound quality are top-notch .

93.sentence: i like the size and weight of this little critter .

94.sentence: i am able to carry it close to my body , in places where other phones are not so easily concealed .

95.sentence: the keys are close together , and the layout is a bit funky in relation to standard rectangular layout keypads , but it 's not too weird .

96.sentence: the fact that the " 0 " key is the space key for text input is a bit confusing , as many phones use the " # " key instead .

97.sentence: the screen is bright , easy to see in the daylight , with nice colors .

98.sentence: it receives very nice mms pictures from other gsm phones .

99.sentence: there are some features in the user interface that i find a little inconvenient .

100.sentence: the menu options appear one at a time , taking up the whole screen , and one has to scroll down one by one , or have memorized where they are in the menu order , to select them by using the number keypad .

102.sentence: so loud , really , that it does n't work terribly well as a silent ringer option .

103.sentence: but , then again , the ringer can be so loud that i heard it ringing inside my office , when i was already out on the street .. .

104.sentence: other things that i miss are voice-activated dialing and a standard 2.5 mm headset jack .

125.sentence: and really this is the best phone one could have .

144.sentence: the loud speaker function on the 6610 is great because you do n't need to put your phone right next to your ear to talk .

149.sentence: overall this is a slightly better than average phone .

177.sentence: the hands-free speakerphone is quite powerful ( like the motorola phone , i used to own ) .
